p: In an epidemic, symptomatic cases are the predominant focus of treatment and usually represent the bulk of reported cases. However, infected individuals who are asymptomatic yet infectious can be a critical factor in the spread of some pathogens ( Fraser et al., 2004). Asymptomatic individuals are hard to trace, unlikely to self-isolate, and are likely to retain normal social and travel patterns ( Quilty et al., 2020).
